name: Nominative
uses: Subject of the sentence (e.g., **Kot** pije mleko / **The cat** drinks milk).
Predicate nominative with the verb 'być' (to be) (e.g., To jest **dom** / This is a **house**).

name: Genitive
uses: Expressing possession (e.g., samochód **ojca** / **father's** car).
Negation: Object of a negated verb (e.g., Nie mam **czasu** / I don't have **time**).
Expressing quantity, including numbers greater than 5 (e.g., dużo **pieniędzy** / lots of **money**).
After certain prepositions (e.g., bez, dla, od, u, do).

name: Dative
uses: Indirect object (the recipient of an action) (e.g., Daję **bratu** książkę / I give a book **to my brother**).
Used with verbs that express giving, helping, or showing.
After certain prepositions (e.g., dzięki, przeciwko).

name: Accusative
uses: Direct object of the verb (what or whom the action directly affects) (e.g., Widzę **samochód** / I see **a car**).
Expressing movement toward or duration of time (e.g., Idę **przez las** / I go **through the forest**).
After certain prepositions (e.g., przez, na, o, pod, nad, za, w, po, mimo) when indicating motion or time.

name: Instrumental
uses: Indicating the instrument or means by which an action is performed (e.g., Piszę **długopisem** / I write **with a pen**).
Expressing accompaniment (e.g., Idę **z psem** / I go **with a dog**).
Used with the verb 'być' (to be) when describing a permanent state or profession (e.g., Jestem **nauczycielem** / I am **a teacher**).
After certain prepositions (e.g., z, przed, nad, pod).

name: Locative
uses: Indicating location (where something is) (e.g., Jestem **w domu** / I am **in the house**).
Always requires a preceding preposition (e.g., o, w, na, przy, po).

name: Vocative
uses: Used for direct address or calling out to someone or something (e.g., **Kasiu**! Gdzie jesteś? / **Kasia**! Where are you?).
This case is grammatically optional and rarely used in modern colloquial Polish, except for certain fixed phrases and names.
